001package tv.freewheel.ad.interfaces;
002
003import android.location.Location;
004
005/**
006 * IAdManager is the {@link IAdContext} creator.
007 *
008 * <p>The instance of IAdManager can be retrieved from<br/>
009 * <pre>  public static IAdManager tv.freewheel.ad.AdManager.getInstance(Context context)</pre>
010 * This method requires an Android Context object (usually the application global context) for the ad manager,
011 * and returns the singleton object of IAdManager.
012 *
013 * Note:
014 *      All FreeWheel SDK APIs need to be called on main thread.
015 *
016 * </p>
017 *
018 * <p>AdManager log level could be set via<br/>
019 * <pre>  public static void tv.freewheel.utils.Logger.setLogLevel(int level)</pre>
020 * Log level could be one of:
021 * <br/>
022 * <br/>  -       Logger.VERBOSE
023 * <br/>  -       Logger.DEBUG
024 * <br/>  -       Logger.INFO
025 * <br/>  -       Logger.WARN
026 * <br/>  -       Logger.ERROR
027 * <br/>  -       Logger.ASSERT
028 * <br/>
029 * </p>
030 *
031 */
032public interface IAdManager {
033        
034        /**
035         *  Set alternative address of FreeWheel Ad Server.
036         *  
037         *  @param url url of the alternative FreeWheel Ad Server
038         */
039        public void setServer(String url);
040
041        /**
042         *  Set the network id of the distributor.
043         *            
044         *  Note:
045         *      This method should only be invoked only once.
046         *      
047         *  @param networkId network id of the distributor
048         */
049        public void setNetwork(int networkId);
050        
051        /**
052         *      Set the current location of device. This value will be used by AdContext objects created from this AdManager object for geo targeting.
053         *
054         *      @param  location value of the location to be set. null has no effect
055         */
056        public void setLocation(Location location);
057
058        /**
059         *  Create a new ad context.
060         *  
061         *  An ad context instance is used to set ad request information for a particular ad or ad set.
062         *  <p>
063         *  Multiple contexts can be created throughout the lifecycle of the FreeWheel AdManager 
064         *  and may exist simultaneously without consequence. 
065         *  Multiple simultaneous contexts are useful to optimize user experience in the network-resource limited environment.
066         *      </p>
067         *
068         *  @return an IAdContext object
069         */
070        public IAdContext newContext();
071        
072        /**
073         *      Create a new context from the original context.
074         *
075         *      The new context copies internal state of the original one for submitting new ad request.
076         *      Following methods DO NOT NEED to call again on the new context: 
077         *  <br>
078         *      <br>      -       setRequestMode
079         *      <br>      -       setCapability
080         *      <br>      -       setVisitor
081         *      <br>      -       setVisitorHttpHeader
082         *      <br>      -       setSiteSection
083         *      <br>      -       setVideoAsset
084         *      <br>      -       setProfile
085         *      <br>      -       startSubsession
086         *      <br>      -       setRequestDuration
087         *      <br>      -       registerVideoDisplay
088         *      <br>      -       setActivity
089         *      <br>      -       setVideoDisplaySize
090         *      <br>      -       setVideoPlayer
091         *      <br>      -       setVideoState
092         *  <br>
093         *      <br>      
094         *      But the method below is REQUIRED to call again on the new context:
095         *              -       submitRequest
096         *
097         *      @param originAdContext  refer to an object of original context          
098         *      @return an IAdContext object    
099         */
100        public IAdContext newContextWithContext(IAdContext originAdContext);
101        
102        /**
103         *  Get the AdManager's version.
104         *  
105         *  @return the version String, e.g. 0x02060000 for v2.6
106         */
107        public int getVersion();
108}
